page.title: 13THE TANNERY,LLANGOLLEN.
page.content: This works is in{Church Street,}the original main road through the town.It opened{250 years ago}as a woollen mill.Later it became a tannery.Then in the 1950's when plastic was introduced it was cheaper to produce than leather, and the demand for leather fell.Now it is a{Collection Depot}for sheep skins.{Eight}men work there five days a week for eight hours a day.The skins come from the{Isle of Man,}the {North Wales}coast and{Wrexham.}The actual work has not changed much over the years.They still use the concrete bath with wooden paddles to beat the fleeces clean.The only modern machines they use are forklift trucks and lorries to load and unload the skins.When the skins have been cleaned most of them go to{Newtown}and are used to make slippers,mittens,gloves or rugs.
